column4: ok, so i'm back in win7 i have the disk manager open but I cant make an extended partition?
I have 2 'unallocated' sections on the disk, a 130.52gb bit and an 64.45gb bit
anyone any idea how i make an extended partition to install into?
can you create an extended partitioni? Meaning do you have free space and dont have 4 primary partitions already?
I have free space and 3 partitions
use gparted to free up the free space, the free space MUST be in the last partition, once you free up space  you can then use that free space as an extended partition
so if i stick all the unallocated space into a partition i should be able to the use that?

youre getting confused, you cant "stick" all the unallocated space into a partition, the unallocated space needs to be at the end of the 3 primary partitions and contiguous -- you can use that free space to create an extended partition
yeah thats what i thought... i may be buggered then because i have a drive in the middle of the unallocated space that i need to keep
if i extend drive that exists to include all the free space and then shrink it again i don't suppose that'll work will it?
if youre drive and your data, feel free to try whateer you want
anytime I use gparted I always backup my stuff first, i've never had a drive fail on me but you never know, hard drives are physical devices and dont last forever
dr_willis now going to do the shrink and hope it moves everything to the beginning of the changed partition
if you created an extended partition you can now create as many partitions you want on that extended parttion
what effect will that have on the data on that partition?
youre confusing yourself -- youre not supposed to have any data on that partition, it should look like this-->[partitionONE][PartitionTWO][partitionTHREE][Extended partition->|a||b|]
ok, yeah i misunderstood you. thanks
